Description: Millennium Health, formerly Millennium Laboratories, agreed to pay $256 million to resolve alleged violations of the False Claims Act for billing Medicare, Medicaid and other federal health care programs for medically unnecessary urine drug and genetic testing and for providing free items to physicians who agreed to refer expensive laboratory testing business to Millennium.

Millennium Health, formerly Millennium Laboratories, agreed to pay $38.6 million to settle multistate litigation alleging that it billed state Medicaid programs for medically unnecessary urine drug and genetic testing and for providing free items to physicians who agreed to refer expensive laboratory testing business to Millennium. This was part of a larger $256 million settlement involving  the U.S. Justice Department; see the Violation Tracker entry at https://www.justice.gov/opa/pr/millennium-health-agrees-pay-256-million-resolve-allegations-unnecessary-drug-and-genetic
Info Source: AG Koster Announces Settlement with Millennium Health, Targeted News Service, November 24, 2015 (via Nexis).

Description: Millennium Health Care Services and its owners were found guilty of a conspiracy to defraud the Medicaid system, by creating false CPR cards for its service workers. The company was ordered to pay $6,985,249 in restitution and $17,500 in fines.
